data.name: Return the tax of an item + the subtotal
data.description:
# You have a store... ...and you need a way to get the tax of an item (obviously), so, you create a JavaScript function that will do it for you! You also need to total the costs to get the final price. You are given two paramaters. The first parameter, `tax`, is the tax percentage. The second paramater, `subtotal` is the price before taxes are added. You also need to add a dollar sign ($) before your output, and you need to round the total to two decimal points. So, if say the output is `"$2"` it should be `"$2.50"`. ### Example: Input: `getPrice(13, 50)`
Output: `"$56.50"` _This is my first kata, so please report any issues/suggestions._
